s: And Tribe’s Dill Pickle Hummus has become a refrigerator staple, in case you want to give one of the brand’s beloved flavored iterations a shot. ... There was a slight sourness to Amazon Kitchen’s take on hummus, but it wasn’t off-putting enough to have it go straight into the trash.

t: Amazon.com: Amazon Kitchen, Classic Hummus, 8 Oz : Grocery & Gourmet Food
s: This hummus is very well priced and is of very good quality for a store bought pre-packaged product. No complaints. ... I like this Amazon brand more than other well know brand.

s: They say it's better than the popular ... best premades they've ever tasted. They also appreciate the consistency and the less oil than other brands. ... Customers find the hummus great value for the price....

t: Amazon.com: Amazon Kitchen, Lemon Hummus, 8 Oz : Grocery & Gourmet Food
s: Customers are satisfied with the quality of the hummus. They mention that it is addictive, perfect, and goes well with everything. Some say that it's better than the Aldi brand humus and compares well to the big name brands.

t: Amazon.com: Customer reviews: Amazon Kitchen, Garlic Hummus, 8 Oz
s: So perhaps that other brand has spoiled me and my family’s tastebuds, but we found this to be rather plain and not very garlicky. Prefer more spice. However, it was an okay deal and made for some decent sandwich spread. However, just using it plain as a dip for carrots did not go over well with the kids. They barely touched it, and when I took a few bites, I discovered why. If you like your hummus ...

t: Amazon.com: Amazon Kitchen, Classic Hummus, 16 Oz : Grocery & Gourmet Food
s: The Amazon Kitchen Classic Hummus has a depth and complexity that render other options seemingly bland and uninspiring. This hummus has a unique character that leaves a lasting impression, making it an instant contender for the top spot on my list of all-time favorite hummus brands.

t: The Best Homemade Hummus - Rainbow Plant Life
s: April 6, 2023 - Soom Foods is easily available on Amazon. Seed + Mill is a smaller operation local to New York and sold at some Whole Foods; if you can find it, it’s liquid gold. For options that are a bit cheaper, Beirut Sesame Paste is quite good and the Whole Foods 365 brand is decent (affiliate links). I don’t have a food processor. Can I use a blender instead? Yes. A high-powered blender with a baton is best and will make the hummus ...
